intro: Oxydectes neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy white seeds dispersed by the wind. Oxydectes neomexicana is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, contributing to local biodiversity.
